etymologies: early 19th century: modern Latin, named after Claude Aubriet (1668–1743), French botanist

notes.text: Aubretia is named after French botanist Claude Aubriet, and the original spelling was aubrieta, which is the plant's genus name. In nontechnical use, however, the forms aubrietia and aubretia are now more usual

definitions: a dwarf evergreen Eurasian trailing plant with dense masses of foliage and purple, pink, or white flowers. It is widely cultivated in rock gardens and on banks.
shortDefinitions: dwarf evergreen Eurasian trailing plant with dense masses of foliage and purple
